addressleaf.section:
15 Novemb
r
1588
Remembrances for
e present Assistant in
Councell
to deale w
t
e States in matters of musters. Copie.

page.lettertext:
fol.94r
Remembrances for the present Assistant in
Councell to deale with the
States
in matters
of Musters.
First that
e States according to their owne agreement w
th
the Mus-
termaster generall in
e
Erle of Leycesters
government doe establish
C
o
missaries resident in all garrisons to joyne with her
Ma
tes
Com-
missaries to passe monethly musters, the w
ch
by their default only
hath not been hetherto duly observed.
Also for the time past that they authorise some officer on their part
to joyne with the present overseer of Musters for her Ma
tie
to examine
and comptroll
e Musterroules and to make up
e accompts and
to determine the Checques: And that
fect Abbreviats Indented
may bee kept mutually under these officers hands for a certeine
Record of her Ma
tes
Charges, and their debt upon Remburcement
to bee aunsweared without cavelling.
That an Act in Councell may also bee made and some day as-
signed for
e States to bring in all such debts as they can require, to
be defalked upon
e pay of anie her Ma
tes
bandes or officers,
w
th
expresse condition that they shall never chalenge hereafter
from her Ma
tie
anie other debts then such as shall by such a day
bee presented.
That
e overseer of Musters may have accesse unto
e Coun-
cell to present such matters as he shall have for
e advauncement
of the service of hir Ma
tie
and
e Contrie.
And
t
he may receave
eyther Apostiles to his demaunds, or at
e least testimoniall
of such requests as he shall so present for dischardge of his duty.
15 November
1588.
Yt is thought meet both by her Ma
tie
and
my
LLs
that M
r
Bodley should
pound
these matters to
e States.
Francis Walsingham
